    Team News

    Real Madrid
    • Cristiano Ronaldo limped out of training on Tuesday after a collision with goalkeeper Kiko Casilla and is now a doubt for the final, which would be a huge blow to Real Madrid's chances on Saturday.
    • Raphael Varane has been ruled out of the Champions League with a thigh injury. He is the only player certain to miss the final. Otherwise Zinedine Zidane can select his strongest XI.
    Atletico Madrid
    • Tiago made his first appearance for Atletico in their 2-0 win over Celta Vigo in the last league game of the season following six months out injured. He isn't expected to feature in the final, however, with Diego Simeone likely to select the same XI that started against Celta.
    • Simeone must decide between pairing Gabi with Koke or Augusto Fernandez in the middle of the park.

    Prediction

    • Atletico Madrid will be out to exact revenge on Real Madrid after their cruel defeat in the 2014 Champions League final. Diego Simeone's side have had to overcome Benfica, Bayern Munich and Barcelona on their way to Milan and are deservedly in with a chance of lifting the trophy on Saturday.
    • Real Madrid, meanwhile, have overcome Roma, Wolfsburg and Manchester City on their way to the final and have been fortunate to come through in each of those ties. Given the way they started the season, it would be remarkable for them to finish it with their 11th European title.
    • Since losing in extra-time in the Champions League final two years ago, Atletico are 10 games undefeated against their city rivals and have one of the meanest backlines in Europe. Even though Cristiano Ronaldo has scored as many goals in Europe this season than Atletico have managed as a team (both 16), this is going to be some test for Madrid and one that may prove too far for Zidane and his side.
    Prediction:
    Real Madrid
    0
    1
    Atletico Madrid

    • [ - ] John_Wick - member since 14-Apr-15

      Inevitably, the only way around this compact block is to switch play towards the opposite flank, although this is easier said than done. Atletico crowd opposition wide players so effectively when they have possession that a square pass is often extremely risky.

      4 years ago
       +1 Reply Report Sign in or join us to rate comments! Sign In || Join Us
    • [ - ] John_Wick - member since 14-Apr-15

      @Castle Atletico are compact not just vertically (from defence to attack) but also horizontally (from left to right). They encourage opposition teams to play passes towards the wings, before shutting them down quickly and efficiently, boxing in opponents towards the touchline. To prevent gaps forming between midfielders to guard against penetrative passes, Atletico's wide midfielder on the opposite flank moves towards the ball.

      4 years ago
